events.title: Formation of NASA
events.description: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) was formed.

events.title: Apollo 11 Moon Landing
events.description: Apollo 11 landed on the moon, marking the first time humans set foot on the lunar surface.

events.title: Launch of Voyager 1
events.description: NASA launched Voyager 1, a space probe aimed at exploring the outer planets and interstellar space.

events.title: Launch of Voyager 2
events.description: NASA launched Voyager 2, a space probe aimed at exploring the outer planets and beyond.

events.title: Hubble Space Telescope Launch
events.description: NASA launched the Hubble Space Telescope, providing unprecedented views of the universe.

events.title: Mars Pathfinder Mission
events.description: NASA's Mars Pathfinder mission successfully landed on Mars, deploying the Sojourner rover.

events.title: Launch of the International Space Station
events.description: The first module of the International Space Station (ISS) was launched, marking the beginning of its construction.

events.title: Cassini-Huygens Mission to Saturn
events.description: NASA's Cassini spacecraft entered orbit around Saturn and later deployed the Huygens probe to Titan.

events.title: New Horizons Mission to Pluto
events.description: NASA's New Horizons spacecraft conducted a flyby of Pluto, providing the first close-up images of the dwarf planet.

events.title: Curiosity Rover Lands on Mars
events.description: NASA's Curiosity rover successfully landed on Mars, beginning its mission to explore the planet's surface.

events.title: Launch of the James Webb Space Telescope
events.description: NASA launched the James Webb Space Telescope, a powerful space telescope designed to study the universe in unprecedented detail.

events.title: First Space Tourist Flight
events.description: Dennis Tito became the first space tourist, flying to the International Space Station on a Russian Soyuz spacecraft.

events.title: Launch of the Large Hadron Collider
events.description: The Large Hadron Collider (LHC), the world's largest and most powerful particle accelerator, was launched.

events.title: First Space Shuttle Launch
events.description: NASA's Space Shuttle Columbia launched on its maiden flight, marking the first reusable spacecraft.

events.title: Mars Science Laboratory (MSL) Launch
events.description: NASA launched the Mars Science Laboratory, which carried the Curiosity rover to Mars.

events.title: Voyager 1 Enters Interstellar Space
events.description: NASA's Voyager 1 became the first human-made object to enter interstellar space.

events.title: First Female Spacewalk
events.description: Svetlana Savitskaya became the first woman to perform a spacewalk.

events.title: First Mars Rover Mission
events.description: NASA's Mars Pathfinder mission successfully landed on Mars and deployed the Sojourner rover.

events.title: Launch of the Parker Solar Probe
events.description: NASA launched the Parker Solar Probe, designed to study the outer corona of the Sun.

events.title: First Image of a Black Hole
events.description: The Event Horizon Telescope collaboration released the first image of a black hole.

events.title: SpaceX Crew Dragon First Manned Flight
events.description: SpaceX's Crew Dragon spacecraft successfully launched its first crewed mission to the International Space Station.

events.title: Mars Perseverance Rover Landing
events.description: NASA's Perseverance rover successfully landed on Mars to search for signs of past life.

events.title: Launch of the Huygens Probe
events.description: The European Space Agency's Huygens probe was launched aboard NASA's Cassini spacecraft to explore Titan, Saturn's largest moon.

events.title: Mars InSight Lander
events.description: NASA's InSight lander successfully landed on Mars to study the planet's interior.

events.title: Launch of the Mars Odyssey Orbiter
events.description: NASA's Mars Odyssey orbiter was launched to map the Martian surface and search for signs of water.

events.title: Voyager 2 Completes Grand Tour of the Outer Planets
events.description: Voyager 2 completed its grand tour of the outer planets, providing valuable data and images.

events.title: Discovery of Exoplanet Proxima Centauri b
events.description: Astronomers discovered Proxima Centauri b, an exoplanet orbiting the closest star to our solar system.

events.title: Launch of the Kepler Space Telescope
events.description: NASA launched the Kepler Space Telescope to search for Earth-like planets in the habitable zones of other stars.

events.title: Launch of the Chandra X-ray Observatory
events.description: NASA launched the Chandra X-ray Observatory to study high-energy regions of the universe.

events.title: Launch of the Spitzer Space Telescope
events.description: NASA launched the Spitzer Space Telescope to study the universe in infrared light.

events.title: First Detection of Gravitational Waves
events.description: Scientists made the first detection of gravitational waves, confirming a major prediction of Einstein's general theory of relativity.

events.title: First Private Manned Spaceflight
events.description: SpaceShipOne completed the first privately funded manned spaceflight.

events.title: Launch of the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter
events.description: NASA launched the Mars Reconnaissance Orbiter to study Mars' atmosphere and terrain from orbit.

events.title: First Landing on a Comet
events.description: The European Space Agency's Rosetta mission successfully landed the Philae probe on comet 67P/Churyumov-Gerasimenko.

events.title: Launch of the Galileo Spacecraft
events.description: NASA's Galileo spacecraft was launched to study Jupiter and its moons.

events.title: Launch of the James Webb Space Telescope
events.description: NASA launched the James Webb Space Telescope, the most powerful space telescope ever built.

events.title: First Space Station
events.description: The Soviet Union launched Salyut 1, the world's first space station.

events.title: Launch of the Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter
events.description: NASA launched the Lunar Reconnaissance Orbiter to map the moon's surface.

events.title: First Mars Helicopter Flight
events.description: NASA's Ingenuity helicopter made its first flight on Mars, demonstrating the feasibility of powered flight on another planet.

events.title: Launch of the Juno Spacecraft
events.description: NASA launched the Juno spacecraft to study Jupiter's atmosphere and magnetosphere.

events.title: Discovery of Water on the Moon
events.description: NASA's LCROSS mission confirmed the presence of water ice in a permanently shadowed crater on the moon.

events.title: Launch of the Viking 1
events.description: NASA's Viking 1 spacecraft was launched to explore Mars and search for signs of life.

events.title: First Planet Discovered Around a Sun-Like Star
events.description: Astronomers discovered 51 Pegasi b, the first exoplanet found orbiting a Sun-like star.

events.title: Launch of the Mars Global Surveyor
events.description: NASA's Mars Global Surveyor was launched to map the Martian surface.

events.title: Launch of the Hubble Space Telescope
events.description: NASA launched the Hubble Space Telescope, providing unprecedented views of the universe.

events.title: Launch of the Dawn Spacecraft
events.description: NASA's Dawn spacecraft was launched to study the protoplanet Vesta and the dwarf planet Ceres.

events.title: Discovery of TRAPPIST-1 System
events.description: Astronomers discovered seven Earth-sized planets orbiting the ultracool dwarf star TRAPPIST-1.

events.title: Launch of the TESS Space Telescope
events.description: NASA's TESS (Transiting Exoplanet Survey Satellite) was launched to search for exoplanets.

events.title: Launch of the OSIRIS-REx Mission
events.description: NASA's OSIRIS-REx mission was launched to return samples from the asteroid Bennu.

events.title: First Detection of Fast Radio Bursts
events.description: Astronomers detected the first fast radio bursts (FRBs), mysterious high-energy astrophysical phenomena.

events.title: First Spacewalk
events.description: Alexei Leonov became the first person to conduct a spacewalk.

events.title: First Satellite Launched
events.description: The Soviet Union launched Sputnik 1, the world's first artificial satellite.

events.title: First Human in Space
events.description: Yuri Gagarin became the first human to journey into outer space.

events.title: First American in Space
events.description: Alan Shepard became the first American to travel into space.

events.title: First American to Orbit the Earth
events.description: John Glenn became the first American to orbit the Earth.

events.title: Launch of the Lunar Module Eagle
events.description: Apollo 11's Lunar Module Eagle was launched, carrying Neil Armstrong and Buzz Aldrin to the moon's surface.

events.title: First Mars Landing
events.description: NASA's Viking 1 lander successfully landed on Mars, conducting experiments and sending back images.

events.title: First Reusable Spacecraft
events.description: NASA launched Space Shuttle Columbia, the first reusable spacecraft.

events.title: First Space Telescope
events.description: NASA launched the Hubble Space Telescope, providing unprecedented views of the universe.

events.title: First Space Station Crew
events.description: The first crew of the International Space Station (ISS) was launched, beginning continuous human presence in space.

events.title: First Landing on an Asteroid
events.description: NASA's NEAR Shoemaker spacecraft successfully landed on the asteroid Eros.

events.title: First Powered Flight on Mars
events.description: NASA's Ingenuity helicopter made its first powered flight on Mars, demonstrating the feasibility of aerial exploration on the Red Planet.
